name: 2 Ingredient Coconut Flour Tortillas
instructions: Mix coconut flour and water in a bowl until a smooth, pliable dough forms.
Knead the dough briefly on a clean surface to ensure even consistency.
Divide the dough into small, equal-sized portions and roll each into a ball.
Flatten each ball with a tortilla press or rolling pin to create thin, round tortillas.
Cook each tortilla in a dry skillet over medium heat for 1-2 minutes per side until lightly browned.
Transfer cooked tortillas to a plate and cover with a clean towel to keep warm and soft.

name: Air Fried Salmon Recipe
instructions: Pat salmon filets dry with paper towels to remove excess moisture.
Brush salmon with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
Preheat air fryer to 400°F for even cooking.
Place salmon in air fryer basket, skin side down, without overcrowding.
Cook salmon for 7-8 minutes until it reaches desired doneness and flakes easily.
Let salmon rest for 2-3 minutes before serving.

name: Avocado Chimichurri on Cucumber
instructions: Finely chop parsley and garlic to make chimichurri sauce.
Mix chopped herbs with vinegar to create a tangy herb sauce.
Slice cucumber into thin rounds and arrange on a serving plate.
Slice avocado and place pieces on top of cucumber slices.
Drizzle chimichurri sauce generously over avocado and cucumber.
Serve immediately as a fresh, light appetizer or snack.

name: Avocado Grilled Salmon Dish
instructions: Season the salmon with herbs and spices, then grill until it's cooked through and has nice char marks.
While the salmon is cooking, chop your selected vegetables and sauté them lightly in olive oil until tender-crisp.
Slice the avocado into thin, even pieces or cubes.
Place the grilled salmon on a plate and arrange the sautéed vegetables around it.
Top the salmon with avocado slices, drizzle with additional olive oil, and add a final sprinkle of herbs.
Serve immediately while the salmon is still warm.

name: Baked Sweet-Potato Slices
ingredients: 2 large sweet potatoes, sliced into 1/4-inch rounds
instructions: Wash sweet potatoes and slice them into even, thin rounds.
Arrange potato slices on a baking sheet in a single layer without overlapping.
Drizzle olive oil over the slices and sprinkle with sea salt.
Bake in a preheated oven until edges are crispy and centers are tender.
Remove from oven and let cool for a few minutes before serving.

name: Beef Bone Broth
ingredients: 3 lbs roasted beef bones (marrow and knuckle)
instructions: Roast beef bones and chopped vegetables in the oven until they develop a deep golden-brown color.
Transfer the roasted bones and vegetables to a large stockpot and cover completely with cold water.
Add herbs and spices, then bring the liquid to a gentle simmer, skimming off any foam that rises to the top.
Reduce heat to low and let the broth simmer slowly for 12-24 hours, occasionally adding water to keep bones covered.
Strain the broth through a fine-mesh sieve, discarding the solids and reserving the clear, rich liquid.
Cool the broth quickly and store in containers, or use immediately in recipes.

name: Bone Broth
ingredients: 2-3 lbs roasted bones (chicken carcass or beef marrow bones)
2-3 cups vegetable scraps (onion ends, carrot peels, celery leaves)
Optional: 1 tsp black peppercorns, bay leaves, fresh herbs
instructions: Place bones and vegetable scraps in a large stockpot or slow cooker.
Add water to cover the bones completely, then stir in a splash of apple cider vinegar.
Bring the mixture to a gentle simmer and cook on low heat for 12-24 hours, skimming off any foam that forms on the surface.
Strain the broth through a fine-mesh strainer, discarding the solids and reserving the clear, nutrient-rich liquid.
Let the broth cool, then transfer to storage containers and refrigerate or freeze until ready to use.

name: Cajun Salmon
ingredients: FOR THE HOMEMADE CAJUN SEASONING (Makes ~1/4 cup):
1 lemon, cut into wedges for serving
instructions: MAKE THE CAJUN SEASONING: Add all spices to a small bowl or jar.
Mix well or shake to combine. Store in an airtight container for up to 6 months.
PREPARE THE SALMON:
Pat salmon fillets dry with paper towels and generously coat both sides with Cajun seasoning.
Heat a skillet over medium-high heat and add a thin layer of oil.
Place salmon skin-side down in the hot skillet and cook for 4-5 minutes until the bottom is crispy and golden.
Flip the salmon and cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, or until fish is cooked through and reaches an internal temperature of 145°F.
Remove from heat, squeeze fresh lemon juice over the fillets, and serve immediately.

name: Roasted Cabbage Steaks
ingredients: 1 large head cabbage, sliced into 1-inch steaks
instructions: Cut cabbage into thick "steaks" about 1-inch thick, keeping the core intact to hold slices together.
Brush each cabbage steak generously with olive oil and sprinkle with garlic powder, onion powder, paprika, chili powder, Italian herbs, salt, and pepper.
Place seasoned cabbage steaks on a lined baking sheet and roast in a preheated 425°F oven for 25-30 minutes, flipping halfway through.
Top roasted cabbage steaks with marinara sauce and sliced baby peppers during the last 5-7 minutes of cooking.
Remove from oven when cabbage edges are crispy and caramelized, and let rest for 2-3 minutes before serving.
Plate and garnish with nutritional yeast and fresh herbs if desired, serving immediately while hot and crispy.

name: Chicken Detox Soup
ingredients: 1 3/4 cup cooked chickpeas (from 3/4 cup dried, organic)
instructions: In a large pot, sauté chopped onions, garlic, and peppers in healthy oil until fragrant.
Add chopped vegetables, beans, lentils, and vegetable broth, then bring to a gentle simmer.
Stir in coconut milk, herbs, and spices, and continue cooking until vegetables are tender.
Add leafy greens like kale and spinach in the last few minutes of cooking.
Optional: Top with fresh berries before serving for added nutrition and flavor.
Serve hot in bowls, enjoying a nutrient-dense and comforting detox soup.

name: Chickpea Salad
ingredients: 3 1/2 cups cooked chickpeas (from 1 1/2 cups dried, organic)
instructions: Drain and rinse the chickpeas thoroughly in a colander.
Dice the cucumber and tomatoes into small, uniform pieces.
Chop fresh parsley and mix with the chickpeas, cucumber, and tomatoes.
Whisk together the lemon dressing and pour over the salad.
Gently toss all ingredients until well combined.
Chill for 15-20 minutes before serving to let flavors meld together.

name: Cilantro Lemon Zucchini Noodles
instructions: Spiralize or julienne zucchini into thin noodles, creating a light and fresh base for the dish.
Mince garlic and chop fresh cilantro, preparing the flavor-boosting ingredients.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat and lightly sauté the garlic until fragrant.
Add zucchini noodles to the skillet and toss quickly, cooking for 1-2 minutes to warm through without making them soggy.
Remove from heat, squeeze fresh lemon juice over the noodles, and season with salt and pepper.
Garnish with chopped cilantro and serve immediately as a light, clean, and refreshing meal.

name: Cilantro Lime Cauliflower Rice
instructions: Rice the cauliflower by pulsing florets in a food processor until they resemble rice grains.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
Sauté the diced onion and minced garlic until soft and fragrant, about 3-4 minutes.
Add the riced cauliflower and vegetable broth, stirring to combine.
Cook for 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally, until cauliflower is tender but not mushy.
Remove from heat and stir in fresh cilantro, lime juice, lime zest, salt, and pepper.
Serve immediately as a fresh, flavorful side dish.

name: Cracklin' Cauliflower
ingredients: 1 large head cauliflower, cut into florets
instructions: Cut cauliflower into evenly sized florets.
Toss cauliflower with oil and spices until well coated.
Spread florets in a single layer on a baking sheet.
Roast in a hot oven until edges are crispy and golden brown.
Remove from oven and serve immediately while still crunchy.

name: Creamy Zucchini Soup
instructions: Chop zucchini, onions, and garlic into roughly similar-sized pieces.
Heat olive oil in a large pot and sauté the onions and garlic until soft and fragrant.
Add chopped zucchini and vegetable broth to the pot, then bring to a gentle simmer.
Cook the vegetables until they are tender and easily pierced with a fork, about 15-20 minutes.
Use an immersion blender or regular blender to puree the soup until smooth and creamy.
Season with your favorite herbs and spices, and serve hot with a drizzle of olive oil on top.

name: Crunchy Flax + Chia Seed Crackers
description: Crunchy Flax + Chia Seed Crackers - A delicious detox-approved recipe
ingredients: 1/2 tsp dried herbs (rosemary, thyme, or Italian blend)
instructions: Combine flaxseeds, chia seeds, salt, and herbs in a bowl.
Add water and stir well.
Let sit 10-15 minutes, until thick and gelled.
Spread mixture thinly on a parchment-lined baking sheet.
Bake at 300°F (150°C) for 35-45 minutes.
Flip or score crackers halfway through for even drying.
Bake until fully dry and crisp. Cool completely before breaking.

name: Crunchy Flaxseed Crackers
description: Crispy and nutritious crackers made with organic flaxseeds.
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
Mix ground flaxseeds, salt, garlic powder, and onion powder in a bowl.
Add water and stir until well combined.
Let mixture sit for 5 minutes to thicken.
Spread mixture thinly onto a parchment-lined baking sheet.
Score into cracker-sized squares with a knife.
Bake for 20-25 minutes until edges are crispy.
Cool completely before breaking along scored lines.

name: Crunchy Root Detox Salad
instructions: Chop all vegetables into similar-sized pieces and sauté in olive oil until slightly softened.
Cook lentils in vegetable broth until tender, then drain and set aside to cool.
Roast sweet potato and broccoli in the oven until edges are crispy and golden.
Mix roasted vegetables, lentils, raw chopped kale and spinach in a large bowl.
Drizzle with coconut cream and sprinkle with fresh herbs, berries, and spices.
Toss everything together and serve immediately at room temperature.

name: Curried Yellow Split Pea Soup
ingredients: 1 1/2 cups dried yellow split peas, rinsed
instructions: In a large pot, sauté diced onions, minced garlic, and grated ginger until fragrant and softened.
Add yellow split peas, curry powder, and fennel seeds, stirring to coat the peas with the spices.
Pour in vegetable broth and bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer until the peas are tender and breaking down.
Stir in coconut milk and continue cooking until the soup reaches a creamy consistency.
Remove from heat, squeeze in fresh lime juice, and season with salt to taste.
Serve hot, garnished with toasted coconut chips for added crunch and flavor.

name: Colorful Red Lentil Soup
description: Silky red lentil soup with cumin.
instructions: Sauté chopped onions, garlic, and carrots in a large pot until softened and fragrant.
Add red lentils, vegetable broth, and your chosen herbs and spices to the pot.
Simmer the mixture on medium-low heat, stirring occasionally, until lentils are tender and breaking down.
Pour in coconut milk/cream and stir to create a creamy, rich texture.
Taste and adjust seasonings, then let the lentil stew sit for a few minutes to develop flavors.
Serve hot, garnished with fresh herbs if desired.

name: Detox Cabbage Soup
instructions: Chop cabbage, onions, carrots, celery, garlic, and ginger into small, uniform pieces.
Heat olive oil in a large pot and sauté the chopped onions, garlic, and ginger until fragrant and softened.
Add the remaining chopped vegetables to the pot and cook for 5-7 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Pour in vegetable broth and add desired herbs and spices, then bring the mixture to a gentle simmer.
Cover the pot and let the soup cook on low heat for 20-25 minutes until vegetables are tender.
Taste and adjust seasonings, then serve the hot detox cabbage soup in bowls.

name: Detox Lentil Soup
instructions: Rinse lentils and chop all vegetables into small, uniform pieces.
Heat olive oil in a large pot and sauté onions and garlic until fragrant.
Add chopped vegetables and lentils to the pot, then pour in vegetable broth.
Bring the soup to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer until lentils are tender.
Season with herbs and spices, stirring occasionally.
Serve hot, garnished with fresh chopped kale or spinach.

name: DETOX SOUP
instructions: Dice chicken breasts and sauté in avocado oil until golden and cooked through.
Chop all vegetables into roughly similar-sized pieces for even cooking.
In a large pot, combine cooked chicken, chopped vegetables, vegetable broth, and your selected herbs and spices.
Simmer the soup over medium heat until vegetables are tender and flavors have melded, approximately 20-25 minutes.
Garnish with shredded coconut and serve hot.
Optional: Stir in fresh chopped herbs just before serving for added brightness.

name: Detox Turmeric Lentil Soup
instructions: Rinse lentils and chop all vegetables into uniform pieces.
In a large pot, sauté onions and garlic until fragrant and translucent.
Add turmeric, other spices, chopped vegetables, and lentils to the pot, stirring to combine.
Pour in vegetable broth and coconut milk, then bring the mixture to a gentle simmer.
Cook the soup on low heat until lentils are tender and vegetables are soft, about 25-30 minutes.
Taste and adjust seasonings, then serve hot in bowls.

name: Dijon Roasted Turkey
ingredients: 2 tbsp fresh herbs (rosemary, thyme, sage), minced
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F and pat the turkey breast dry with paper towels.
Mix Dijon mustard, olive oil, chopped herbs, salt, and pepper in a small bowl to create a flavorful coating.
Generously brush the mustard mixture all over the turkey breast, ensuring even coverage.
Place the turkey breast in a roasting pan and roast in the preheated oven until the internal temperature reaches 165°F.
Remove from the oven and let the turkey rest for 10-15 minutes before slicing.
Slice and serve the turkey with any remaining pan juices.

name: Easy Flaxseed Crackers
description: Simple and quick flaxseed crackers with minimal ingredients.
ingredients: 1/2 tsp Italian herbs (dried oregano, basil, thyme)
instructions: Combine flaxseeds, salt, and Italian herbs in a bowl.
Pour in water and mix well.
Let sit for 10-15 minutes until mixture gels.
Preheat oven to 300°F (150°C).
Spread mixture very thin on a parchment-lined baking sheet.
Bake for 30-40 minutes, checking frequently.
Flip halfway through for even crisping.
Bake until completely dry and crisp.
Cool and break into pieces.

name: Fall Cleanse Kale Salad
ingredients: 1 large bunch kale, stems removed and chopped
instructions: Wash kale and remove tough stems, then chop into bite-sized pieces.
Slice delicata squash and beets into thin, even rounds and toss with olive oil.
Roast squash and beets on a baking sheet at 425°F until edges are crispy and vegetables are tender.
Massage chopped kale with lemon juice and minced garlic to soften the leaves.
Combine roasted vegetables with massaged kale and top with toasted pumpkin seeds.
Drizzle with additional olive oil and serve at room temperature.

name: Fall Harvest Bowl
ingredients: 2 medium sweet potatoes, cubed and roasted
1 3/4 cup cooked chickpeas (from 3/4 cup dried, organic), roasted
instructions: Wash and chop all vegetables into roughly uniform pieces to ensure even cooking.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet or Dutch oven over medium heat and sauté onions and garlic until fragrant.
Add chopped vegetables, beans, and lentils to the skillet, stirring to combine and coat with oil and seasonings.
Pour in bone broth or vegetable broth, then simmer everything together until vegetables are tender and lentils are cooked through.
Stir in coconut milk and fresh herbs to create a creamy, flavorful base, and cook for an additional 5 minutes.
Serve hot, garnished with fresh berries and additional herbs for brightness and color.

name: Faux-Tatoes
ingredients: 1 large head cauliflower (about 1.5 lbs), cut into florets
instructions: Cut cauliflower into florets and pat completely dry with paper towels.
Place cauliflower in a food processor and pulse until it reaches a rice-like consistency.
Heat olive oil or ghee in a large skillet and add minced garlic, sautéing until fragrant.
Add riced cauliflower to the skillet and cook, stirring frequently, until it becomes tender and slightly golden.
Season with salt to taste and continue cooking until the cauliflower reaches a fluffy, potato-like texture.
Remove from heat and serve immediately as a low-carb side dish.

name: Feel Good Veggie Detox Soup
ingredients: 1 3/4 cup cooked black beans (from 3/4 cup dried, organic)
1 3/4 cup cooked chickpeas (from 3/4 cup dried, organic)
instructions: Chop all vegetables into roughly uniform pieces to ensure even cooking.
In a large pot, sauté onions and garlic in olive oil until fragrant and translucent.
Add chopped vegetables, beans, lentils, and vegetable broth, then bring to a gentle simmer.
Cook the soup for 20-25 minutes, stirring occasionally, until vegetables are tender and beans are soft.
Stir in coconut milk, fresh herbs, and spices, then blend partially or fully depending on desired texture.
Garnish with fresh berries and additional herbs before serving hot.

name: French Onion Zoodle Bake
instructions: Spiralize zucchini into noodles and set aside while caramelizing sliced onions in olive oil over medium-low heat.
Add minced garlic to the onions and cook until fragrant, then stir in herbs and spices.
Pour broth and coconut milk into the onion mixture, creating a rich, creamy sauce.
Layer zucchini noodles in a baking dish, then pour the onion sauce evenly over the top.
Bake in a preheated oven until the zoodles are tender and the sauce is bubbling.
Let the dish rest for a few minutes before serving hot.

name: Gazpacho
ingredients: 2 lbs ripe tomatoes, cored and roughly chopped
1 red bell pepper, seeded and chopped
Fresh basil or parsley for garnish
instructions: Roughly chop all fresh vegetables and place them in a blender.
Add olive oil, red wine vinegar, garlic, and your preferred herbs and spices to the blender.
Blend the mixture until smooth and well combined, about 1-2 minutes.
Taste and adjust seasoning as needed, adding salt and pepper to your preference.
Chill the gazpacho in the refrigerator for at least one hour to let the flavors meld.
Serve cold, garnished with additional chopped vegetables or herbs if desired.

name: Green Detox Smoothie
instructions: Wash spinach, kale, and cucumber thoroughly to remove any dirt or debris.
Roughly chop the spinach and kale, and slice the cucumber into chunks.
Cut the avocado in half, remove the pit, and scoop out the flesh.
Add all ingredients to a blender, and squeeze in fresh lemon juice.
Blend on high speed until smooth and creamy, about 30-45 seconds.
Pour into a glass and enjoy immediately.

name: Green Detox Soup
ingredients: 1 3/4 cup cooked chickpeas (from 3/4 cup dried, organic)
instructions: Chop all vegetables into roughly similar-sized pieces to ensure even cooking.
In a large pot, sauté onions and garlic in olive oil until fragrant and translucent.
Add chopped vegetables, beans, lentils, and vegetable broth, then simmer until vegetables are tender.
Stir in coconut milk and blend the soup using an immersion blender until smooth and creamy.
Season with herbs and spices, and garnish with fresh berries before serving.
Let soup cool slightly and serve warm for optimal flavor and nutrition.

name: Green Pea, Asparagus & Parsley Soup
ingredients: 2 cups fresh or frozen green peas
1 lb fresh asparagus, trimmed and chopped
instructions: Dice the onion and mince the garlic, then sauté in olive oil until softened.
Add green peas and asparagus to the pan, cooking until they are bright green and tender-crisp.
Pour in vegetable broth and simmer the vegetables for 5-7 minutes.
Finely chop fresh parsley and sprinkle over the vegetables just before serving.
Season with salt and pepper to taste, and serve hot as a side dish or light meal.

name: Grilled Avocado Burger
instructions: Slice avocado in half and brush with olive oil, then season with herbs and spices.
Grill avocado cut-side down for 2-3 minutes until grill marks appear and surface is lightly charred.
While avocado is grilling, chop onions and tomatoes and prepare any additional desired vegetable toppings.
Flip avocado and continue grilling for another 1-2 minutes to warm through and create a soft, creamy texture.
Remove grilled avocado from heat and top with chopped vegetables, additional herbs, and serve immediately.

name: Hemp Seed Porridge
description: A warm, grain-free breakfast porridge made with hemp seeds, flaxseed, and chia seeds. Creamy, satisfying, and completely detox-approved. Perfect for Days 1-28.
ingredients: 1/2 cup fresh berries (blueberries, raspberries, or blackberries)
instructions: Combine hemp hearts, ground flaxseed, and chia seeds in a small saucepan.
Add coconut milk, water, salt, cinnamon, and ginger. Stir well to combine.
Bring to a gentle simmer over medium heat, stirring frequently.
Reduce heat to low and cook for 3-5 minutes, stirring occasionally, until thickened to desired consistency.
If porridge becomes too thick, add a splash more coconut milk or water.
Remove from heat and let sit for 1-2 minutes to thicken further.
Transfer to a bowl and top with fresh berries and coconut flakes.
Drizzle with coconut oil for extra richness if desired.

name: Homemade Pumpkin Puree
ingredients: 1 tbsp olive oil or coconut oil
instructions: Cut the pumpkin in half and scoop out the seeds and stringy pulp.
Drizzle the pumpkin halves with olive oil and place cut-side down on a baking sheet.
Roast in a preheated oven until the pumpkin is tender and easily pierced with a fork.
Let the pumpkin cool, then scoop out the flesh and puree or mash until smooth.
Use the pumpkin puree in your favorite pie recipe or other dishes.

name: How To Roast Pumpkin Seeds
ingredients: 1 cup raw pumpkin seeds, cleaned and dried
instructions: Rinse the pumpkin seeds thoroughly to remove any pulp and pat them completely dry with paper towels.
Toss the seeds with olive oil, salt, and pepper in a mixing bowl until evenly coated.
Spread the seeds in a single layer on a baking sheet, ensuring they are not overcrowded.
Roast the seeds in a preheated oven at 300°F, stirring occasionally, until they are golden brown and crispy.
Remove from the oven and let the seeds cool for a few minutes before serving.

name: Italian Vinaigrette Dressing
instructions: Finely mince the onion and garlic cloves.
In a mixing bowl, whisk together olive oil, red wine vinegar, and Dijon mustard until fully combined.
Add the minced onion, garlic, chopped basil, and oregano to the vinaigrette base.
Season with sea salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste.
Whisk everything together until the dressing is well blended and slightly emulsified.
Let the vinaigrette sit for 10-15 minutes to allow the flavors to meld before serving.

name: Kale and Brussels Sprout Salad
ingredients: 4 cups fresh kale, stems removed and chopped
2 cups Brussels sprouts, shaved or thinly sliced
1/2 cup fresh berries (blueberries, raspberries) for topping
instructions: Wash kale and Brussels sprouts thoroughly, then pat dry with paper towels.
Thinly slice Brussels sprouts and roughly chop kale into bite-sized pieces.
In a large bowl, toss the vegetables with your chosen healthy oil and herbs/spices.
Let the salad sit for 5-10 minutes to allow the kale to soften slightly.
Top the salad with fresh berries just before serving.
Serve immediately at room temperature or chilled.

name: Kale Chips
ingredients: 1 large bunch kale, stems removed and leaves torn into pieces
instructions: Preheat oven to 300°F and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Wash kale thoroughly, then pat completely dry with paper towels.
Remove thick stems and tear kale leaves into roughly chip-sized pieces.
Drizzle olive oil over kale and massage gently to coat each leaf evenly.
Sprinkle sea salt across the kale leaves and spread them in a single layer on the baking sheet.
Bake for 10-12 minutes, watching carefully to prevent burning, until leaves are crisp and edges are slightly brown.

name: Lemon Pepper Asparagus
instructions: Trim the woody ends off the asparagus spears by snapping or cutting them.
Toss the asparagus with olive oil, ensuring each spear is lightly coated.
Arrange the asparagus in a single layer on a baking sheet.
Roast in a preheated oven until the spears are tender and lightly browned.
Immediately drizzle with fresh lemon juice and sprinkle generously with freshly ground black pepper.
Serve hot as a delicious side dish.

name: Lemongrass Ginger Carrot Soup
ingredients: 2-inch piece fresh ginger, peeled and sliced
instructions: Chop lemongrass, ginger, carrots, onions, and garlic, then sauté in a large pot until fragrant.
Pour in vegetable broth and simmer vegetables until carrots are tender and soft.
Use an immersion blender or transfer to a blender and puree the soup until smooth and creamy.
Stir in coconut milk and season with your chosen herbs and spices to taste.
Simmer for an additional few minutes to blend flavors, then serve hot.

name: Lentil Soup
instructions: Dice the onions, carrots, and celery, then sauté them in a large pot until the onions are translucent.
Add the lentils, vegetable broth, and chopped tomatoes to the pot, and bring the mixture to a boil.
Reduce the heat and simmer the soup, stirring occasionally, until the lentils are tender and fully cooked.
Season the soup with salt and pepper to taste, and adjust the liquid if needed to reach your desired consistency.
Ladle the hot lentil soup into bowls and serve immediately.

name: Lentil-Stuffed Zucchini Boats
ingredients: 1 tsp dried Italian herbs (oregano, basil, thyme)
instructions: Cut zucchini in half lengthwise and scoop out the seeds to create boat-like shells.
Mix cooked lentils with herbs and tomato sauce in a mixing bowl.
Spoon the lentil mixture into the zucchini boats, filling each one generously.
Bake the stuffed zucchini boats in a preheated oven until the zucchini is tender and the filling is heated through.
Remove from oven and let cool for a few minutes before serving.

name: Mama Vegan Chili
description: A hearty, warming vegan chili packed with lentils, beans, and vegetables. Bold southwestern flavors without any sugar or soy. Perfect comfort food for the detox program.
ingredients: 1 cup dried lentils (green or brown), rinsed
1 can (15 oz) black beans, drained and rinsed
1 can (15 oz) kidney beans, drained and rinsed
4 cups vegetable broth or bone broth
2 cups diced fresh tomatoes (or one 14 oz can diced tomatoes)
Sea salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium heat.
Add onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add garlic, bell peppers, carrots, and celery. Cook for another 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add chili powder, cumin, smoked paprika, cayenne, and oregano. Stir to coat vegetables and cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Add tomato paste and stir to combine.
Add lentils, black beans, kidney beans, diced tomatoes, and broth. Stir well.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low. Cover and simmer for 30-40 minutes, until lentils are tender.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
For thicker chili, remove lid and simmer uncovered for an additional 10 minutes.
Serve hot, garnished with fresh cilantro and diced avocado if desired.

name: Mexican Cauliflower Rice
instructions: Pulse cauliflower in a food processor until it resembles rice-like grains.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet and sauté diced onion and minced garlic until softened.
Add cauliflower rice to the skillet and stir in tomato paste, cumin, and chili powder.
Cook the cauliflower mixture, stirring occasionally, until it's tender and lightly browned.
Remove from heat, season with salt and pepper, and squeeze fresh lime juice over the top.
Serve hot as a low-carb alternative to traditional rice.

name: Moroccan Sweet Potato Lentil Soup
ingredients: 2 medium sweet potatoes, peeled and cubed
instructions: Peel and dice sweet potatoes, carrots, and onions into roughly similar-sized pieces.
In a large pot, sauté onions and garlic in olive oil until fragrant and translucent.
Add lentils, diced vegetables, spices, and vegetable broth, then bring to a simmer and cook until lentils and vegetables are tender.
Stir in lime juice and adjust seasonings to taste.
Serve hot, garnished with fresh herbs if desired.

name: Moroccan Sweet Potato Lentil Stew
ingredients: 2 medium sweet potatoes, peeled and cubed
4 cups fresh kale or spinach, chopped
instructions: Dice sweet potatoes and prepare other vegetables by chopping into uniform pieces.
Sauté onions and garlic in olive oil, then add lentils and spices like cumin, paprika, and cinnamon.
Add chopped vegetables and enough water or broth to cook lentils, simmering until lentils are tender and vegetables are soft.
Stir in leafy greens like kale or spinach during the last few minutes of cooking to wilt them gently.
Optional: Top with fresh berries or herbs for added brightness and flavor before serving.
Serve hot as a hearty, nutrient-rich vegetarian main dish.

name: Rainbow Veggie Bean Soup
ingredients: 1 3/4 cup cooked black beans (from 3/4 cup dried, organic)
1 3/4 cup cooked chickpeas (from 3/4 cup dried, organic)
instructions: Chop all vegetables into roughly equal-sized pieces to ensure even cooking.
Heat a large skillet or pot with olive oil and sauté onions and garlic until fragrant.
Add chopped vegetables and beans/lentils to the skillet, stirring to combine and prevent sticking.
Pour in bone broth or vegetable broth and coconut milk, then season generously with herbs and spices.
Simmer the mixture on low heat until vegetables are tender and liquid has reduced slightly.
Top with fresh berries and serve hot as a nutrient-dense, colorful meal.

name: Sauteed Garlic Asparagus
instructions: Wash and trim the woody ends off the asparagus spears.
Peel and mince the garlic cloves.
Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat with a small amount of oil.
Add the asparagus to the skillet and sauté for 3-4 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add the minced garlic and continue cooking for another 1-2 minutes until asparagus is bright green and tender-crisp.
Season with salt and pepper, then serve immediately.

name: Red Cabbage Salad
ingredients: 1/2 head red cabbage, thinly sliced (about 4 cups)
instructions: Finely shred the red cabbage and grate the carrots into thin strips.
In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, lemon juice, apple cider vinegar, minced garlic, salt, and pepper to create the dressing.
Pour the dressing over the cabbage and carrots, then toss thoroughly to coat all the vegetables.
Let the salad sit for 10-15 minutes to allow the flavors to blend and the cabbage to soften slightly.
Just before serving, gently fold in fresh berries to add color and a sweet contrast.
Serve chilled or at room temperature as a vibrant, nutritious salad.

name: Roasted Cauliflower & Brussel Sprouts
ingredients: 1 medium head cauliflower, cut into florets
instructions: Preheat the oven to 425°F and line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Chop the cauliflower and Brussels sprouts into evenly sized pieces, discarding any tough stems.
Spread the vegetables in a single layer on the baking sheet and drizzle generously with olive oil.
Sprinkle salt evenly over the vegetables and toss to ensure they are well coated.
Roast in the oven for 25-30 minutes, stirring once halfway through, until the edges are golden brown and crispy.
Remove from the oven and serve immediately while hot and caramelized.

name: Roasted Garlic & Sweet Potato Soup
ingredients: 2 lbs sweet potatoes, peeled and cubed
2 whole garlic bulbs, tops cut off
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F and cut sweet potatoes into chunks while leaving garlic bulbs whole.
Roast sweet potatoes and garlic bulbs on a baking sheet until potatoes are tender and garlic is soft and caramelized.
Squeeze roasted garlic cloves out of their skins and transfer both garlic and roasted sweet potatoes to a large pot.
Add vegetable broth and simmer the mixture, then use an immersion blender to puree until smooth and creamy.
Stir in coconut milk if desired, and season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot, garnished with optional herbs or a drizzle of olive oil.

name: Spiced Black Beans with Turmeric
ingredients: 3 1/2 cups cooked black beans (from 1 1/2 cups dried, organic)
1 small head cauliflower, cut into florets
instructions: Sauté diced onions and minced garlic in olive oil until fragrant and translucent.
Add black beans, cauliflower, turmeric, cumin, and chili powder to the pan and stir to combine.
Pour in vegetable broth and simmer the mixture over medium-low heat until beans are tender and liquid reduces.
Taste and adjust seasonings, adding salt and pepper as needed.
Serve the spiced black beans hot, garnished with fresh herbs if desired.

name: Spicy Zucchini Cauliflower Rice
instructions: Chop zucchini and cauliflower into small, uniform pieces.
Sauté minced garlic and diced onion in olive oil until fragrant and translucent.
Add chopped zucchini and cauliflower to the pan, stirring to coat with oil and aromatics.
Sprinkle chili powder and cumin over the vegetables, stirring to distribute spices evenly.
Pour in vegetable broth, cover, and simmer until vegetables are tender but not mushy.
Serve hot as a spicy vegetable side dish or light main course.

name: Spinach Vegetable Soup
instructions: Dice onions, garlic, carrots, and celery into small, uniform pieces.
Sauté the chopped vegetables in a large pot over medium heat until onions are translucent and fragrant.
Pour vegetable broth into the pot and bring the mixture to a gentle simmer.
Add spinach to the simmering broth and cook until the leaves are tender and bright green.
Season the soup with salt and pepper to taste, then remove from heat.
Serve the hot soup in bowls, enjoying the fresh, nutritious vegetable medley.

name: Spring Veggie Bowl
ingredients: 1 medium sweet potato, roasted and cubed
1 3/4 cup cooked chickpeas (from 3/4 cup dried, organic), roasted
instructions: Roughly chop all vegetables into similar-sized pieces.
Heat oil in a large skillet and sauté onions and garlic until fragrant.
Add harder vegetables like sweet potato and carrots first, cooking for 5-7 minutes.
Stir in softer vegetables like spinach, kale, and tomatoes, and cook until tender.
Season with herbs and spices, and add broth if desired to create a light sauce.
Garnish with fresh berries and serve hot.

name: Stuffed Bell Peppers
ingredients: 4 large bell peppers, tops cut and seeded
1 3/4 cup cooked black beans (from 3/4 cup dried, organic)
1 3/4 cup cooked chickpeas (from 3/4 cup dried, organic), mashed
instructions: In a large pot, sauté chopped onions and garlic in olive oil until fragrant.
Add diced vegetables and beans/lentils, stirring to combine and coat with oil.
Pour in bone broth or vegetable broth, then add your preferred herbs and spices.
Simmer the mixture on low heat for 25-30 minutes, stirring occasionally until vegetables are tender.
Stir in coconut milk/cream and berries in the last 5 minutes of cooking for added richness.
Serve hot in bowls, garnishing with fresh herbs if desired.

name: Stuffed Sweet Potatoes
ingredients: 1 3/4 cup cooked chickpeas (from 3/4 cup dried, organic)
instructions: Wash sweet potatoes and pierce with a fork, then rub with olive oil and bake at 425°F until soft and easily pierced.
While potatoes bake, sauté chopped garlic and onions in a pan until fragrant and translucent.
Add spinach and chickpeas to the pan, stirring until spinach wilts and chickpeas are heated through.
Pour in coconut milk and sprinkle with your favorite spices, simmering until the mixture is slightly thickened.
Split open the baked sweet potatoes and generously fill with the spinach and chickpea mixture.
Serve immediately, garnishing with additional spices or fresh herbs if desired.

name: Summer Squash Soup
ingredients: 2 lbs summer squash (yellow squash or zucchini), sliced
instructions: Chop onions, garlic, and summer squash into uniform pieces.
Sauté onions and garlic in olive oil until softened and fragrant.
Add chopped summer squash and vegetable broth to the pot, then simmer until squash is tender.
Use an immersion blender or regular blender to puree the soup until smooth.
Season with ground pepper and finish with a squeeze of fresh lemon juice.
Serve hot, garnishing with a drizzle of olive oil if desired.

name: The Ultimate Crunchy Detox Salad
ingredients: 1 3/4 cup cooked chickpeas (from 3/4 cup dried, organic)
instructions: Wash and chop kale, spinach, carrots, tomatoes, onions, garlic, and peppers into bite-sized pieces.
Drain and rinse chickpeas, then pat them dry with a paper towel.
In a large bowl, mix the chopped vegetables and chickpeas, drizzling with olive oil and fresh lemon juice.
Finely chop parsley and sprinkle over the salad for added freshness.
Toss all ingredients together until well combined and serve immediately.

name: Quick & Simple Skinny Soup
ingredients: 1 3/4 cup cooked black beans (from 3/4 cup dried, organic)
1 3/4 cup cooked chickpeas (from 3/4 cup dried, organic)
instructions: Chop all vegetables into uniform bite-sized pieces.
Sauté onions and garlic in olive oil until fragrant and translucent.
Add chopped broccoli, carrots, and sweet potato to the pan and cook until slightly tender.
Stir in spinach, kale, black beans, chickpeas, and lentils, then pour in bone broth or vegetable broth.
Season with your preferred herbs and spices, then simmer until vegetables are fully cooked and flavors are blended.
Finish with a drizzle of coconut milk and top with fresh berries before serving.

name: Shaved Fennel & Celery Salad
instructions: Using a sharp mandoline or knife, thinly slice the fennel and celery into delicate, translucent ribbons.
In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, fresh lemon juice, minced garlic, chopped parsley, salt, and pepper to create a light vinaigrette.
Toss the shaved fennel and celery with the vinaigrette, ensuring the vegetables are evenly coated.
Let the salad sit for 10-15 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together, gently mixing occasionally.
Taste and adjust seasoning with additional salt, pepper, or lemon juice as needed.
Serve chilled or at room temperature as a fresh, crisp side salad.

name: Tuscan Veggie Soup
description: A rustic Italian-inspired soup loaded with white beans, kale, and aromatic herbs. Cozy, nourishing, and perfect for chilly days. Dairy-free and completely detox-approved.
ingredients: 6 cups vegetable broth or bone broth
2 cans (15 oz each) cannellini beans (white beans), drained and rinsed
4 cups fresh kale, stems removed and roughly chopped
Sea salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium heat.
Add onion and cook until softened and slightly golden, about 5-7 minutes.
Add garlic and cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Add carrots, celery, and zucchini. Cook for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Pour in the broth and add tomatoes, rosemary, thyme, oregano, and bay leaf.
Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes.
Add cannellini beans and continue simmering for 10 minutes.
Add chopped kale and cook for another 5 minutes until kale is tender but still bright green.
Remove bay leaf and rosemary sprigs.
Season generously with salt and pepper to taste.
Ladle into bowls and drizzle with a little extra olive oil.
Garnish with fresh basil if desired.

name: Vegan Paella
ingredients: 1 3/4 cup cooked chickpeas (from 3/4 cup dried, organic)
instructions: Sauté chopped onions, garlic, and peppers in olive oil until softened in a large paella pan or wide skillet.
Add diced vegetables like sweet potato, broccoli, and carrots, cooking until they begin to caramelize.
Stir in beans, lentils, and tomatoes, then pour in coconut milk and enough water to cover ingredients.
Simmer the mixture on low heat, stirring occasionally, until vegetables are tender and liquid is mostly absorbed.
Garnish with fresh herbs, berries, and a drizzle of olive oil before serving hot.

name: Vegan Pumpkin Soup
ingredients: 1 sugar pumpkin (about 3 lbs), peeled and cubed, or 4 cups pumpkin puree
instructions: Cut pumpkin into cubes and sauté chopped onions and garlic in olive oil until soft and fragrant.
Add pumpkin cubes and vegetable broth to the pot, then simmer until pumpkin is tender and easily mashed.
Use an immersion blender or transfer soup to a blender and puree until smooth and creamy.
Stir in coconut milk/cream and your preferred spices, then heat through gently without boiling.
Taste and adjust seasoning, then serve hot with a drizzle of coconut cream or pumpkin seeds on top.

name: Vegetable Bean Soup
ingredients: 1 3/4 cup cooked black beans (from 3/4 cup dried, organic)
1 3/4 cup cooked lentils (from 3/4 cup dried, organic)
4 cups bone broth or vegetable broth
instructions: Sauté chopped onions and garlic in olive oil until fragrant and translucent.
Add selected chopped vegetables and beans/lentils to the pan, stirring to combine.
Pour in bone broth or vegetable broth and simmer until vegetables are tender and beans are cooked through.
Stir in coconut milk and season with herbs and spices to enhance flavor.
Top with fresh berries and serve as a nutritious, diabetes-friendly meal.

name: Vegetable Lentil Soup
ingredients: 1 3/4 cup cooked black beans (from 3/4 cup dried, organic)
instructions: Chop all selected vegetables into similar-sized pieces to ensure even cooking.
Heat olive oil in a large pot and sauté onions, garlic, and peppers until softened.
Add vegetable broth, chosen beans or lentils, and remaining chopped vegetables to the pot.
Simmer the soup on medium-low heat until vegetables are tender and beans are cooked through.
Stir in coconut milk and season with herbs and spices to taste.
Serve hot, garnishing with fresh herbs and a few berries for extra flavor.

name: Veggie Dumpling Filling
ingredients: 1 3/4 cup cooked chickpeas (from 3/4 cup dried, organic), mashed
instructions: Finely chop all vegetables and mince garlic.
Sauté vegetables in olive oil until softened and slightly caramelized.
Add cooked chickpeas and stir to combine with vegetables.
Season with herbs and spices, then deglaze pan with coconut milk.
Let mixture cool slightly before using as dumpling filling.
Optional: Garnish with fresh berries for added brightness.

name: Zucchanoush
ingredients: 2 tbsp olive oil, plus more for drizzling
instructions: Grill or roast zucchini until softened and lightly charred on all sides.
Let zucchini cool, then roughly chop and drain any excess liquid.
In a food processor, blend zucchini with garlic, tahini, lemon juice, and salt until smooth.
Drizzle olive oil on top and stir to incorporate.
Chill in refrigerator for at least 30 minutes to let flavors meld.
Serve with pita, crackers, or fresh vegetables for dipping.

name: Zucchini Hummus
instructions: Roughly chop the peeled zucchini and place in a food processor.
Add tahini, lemon juice, minced garlic, and ground cumin to the food processor.
Blend the ingredients until smooth and creamy, stopping to scrape down the sides as needed.
Taste the hummus and adjust seasonings, adding more salt, lemon juice, or cumin if desired.
Transfer to a serving bowl and garnish with a drizzle of olive oil and a sprinkle of paprika.
Serve immediately with pita chips, vegetable sticks, or as a spread.
